message: Thierry Neuville become champion in WRC 2024.
Fastest rally car of all time is Lancia Delta S4, it's max speed is 140mph.
First rally race in Monte Carlo was organized in 1911.
The first official rally event was the 1894 Paris–Rouen race, considered the world's first motoring competition.
The Monte Carlo Rally, first held in 1911, is one of the oldest and most prestigious rallies in the world.
Group B rally cars, introduced in 1982, became famous for their extreme power and were banned in 1986 for safety reasons.
The Safari Rally in Kenya is known as one of the toughest rallies due to its rough terrain and unpredictable weather.
Michele Mouton is the only woman to have won a World Rally Championship event, claiming victory at the 1981 Rallye Sanremo.
The RAC Rally, now known as Wales Rally GB, has been a staple of British motorsport since 1932.
The Pikes Peak International Hill Climb, also known as 'The Race to the Clouds,' is a famous rally-style event in Colorado, USA.
The Dakar Rally, originally from Paris to Dakar, is the most famous off-road endurance rally in the world.
Finnish drivers are renowned in rallying, with the term 'Flying Finns' referring to their dominance in the sport.
Rallying is unique in motorsport for its use of public or private roads, often closed for the event, rather than dedicated race tracks.
